Text.content:
The <FieldSettings> element in example 3 contains data integrity definitions.

<PropertyName>Title</PropertyName> references the Title field by name to make settings possible. <RuleRegex>.*</RuleRegex> is a regular expression preventing the content from being saved without a Title. To facilitate this, we provide the user a default value for the title field with <Default><![CDATA[New title]]></Default>. <RuleType> and <Error> are UI related settings that show the user a meaningful validation message in the case no title is given. error means that the content can't be saved at all if the title is empty.

To show the current date time as a default for the DateTime field and not the 1st January 1970, we use the %(currenttime) Macro. Also, it seems desirable for the DateTime field to synchronize the date values between different locales with <Synchronization>true</Synchronization>. Whilst the textual content of the title field and the text field may be different between the locales, the date field often is a locale independent field.

As a further example, we make the LinkURI an optional field with the combination of the minOccurs=0 and maxOccurs=1 attributes.
